alert.note: Alert for Forsyth; Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 26 at 8:53PM EST until December 27 at 11:00PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek near Alpharetta affecting Fulton and Forsyth Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding will continue. * WHERE...Big Creek near Alpharetta. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...Between 7 feet and 8 feet, minor flooding of woodlands and fields occurs along the creek between Cumming in Forsyth County, to Alpharetta and Roswell in North Fulton County. Flooding affects portions of The Big Creek Greenway near Alpharetta and some portions may become closed with around 1 foot of water, especially upstream and downstream from the gage on Kimball Bridge Road and near Rock Mill Park. Portions of the YMCA Campground off Preston Ridge Road will flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 7.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 7.9 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday evening. - Flood stage is 7 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 900 AM EST.
